conclusion: Analyze the motion of the electron in the electric field using initial conditions and deflection angle.
Initial velocity v0 is given as 4 x 10^6 m/s.
Electron is injected perpendicular to the electric field.
Initial velocity components are v0x = v0 and v0y = 0.
At point C, velocity forms a 30-degree angle with initial direction.
Final velocity components are vx = vC cos(30) and vy = vC sin(30).
Horizontal component of velocity remains unchanged: v0 = vC cos(30).
Vertical component is due to acceleration caused by the electric field.
Solving for vC: vC = v0 / cos(30).
Rationalizing the denominator: vC = (8 x 10^6 x sqrt(3)) / 3.
Kinetic energy K is given by K = 1/2 m vC^2.
Substituting values: K = 1/2 x 0.91 x 10^-30 x (4.62 x 10^6)^2.
The kinetic energy of the electron at point C is approximately 9.71 x 10^-18 J.
